Welcome to Contacts REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

REST API repository Users¶

Functions for working with users in the database.

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Sets a user’s email confirmed status to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to update.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → Type[User] | None¶

Retrieves a single user with the specified email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → Type[User]¶

Updates avatar of a single user with given email. :param email: The email of the user. :type email: str :param url: Link to the new avatar. :type url: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User with updated avatar. :rtype: Type[User]

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates token of a single user with the specified ID.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update.

  • token (str | None) – The new token for the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None
